Meeting Title: Oregon Retirement Savings Plan - Plan Design Working Group
Details: The ORSP Board is setting up a work group to address plan design issues - essentially, what the plan will look like.  The group will meet once or twice a month, probably through June or July.  Our goal is to identify the key plan options and the pros and cons of each option, to assist in the Board's decision-making.

The Honorable Kate Brown
Governor of the State of Oregon

Short Description: Notice of public hearing regarding Oregon Higher Education refunding bonds
Details:
A public hearing will be held by the State of Oregon (the “State”) on Thursday, July 9, 2020; at 3:00 p.m. by telephone due to Governor Kate Brown’s Executive Order No. 20-12 issued on March 23, 2020, restricting public gatherings in response to the COVID-19 outbreak. The call-in number is 1-888-636-3807, passcode: 662435. The purpose of the public hearing is to provide an opportunity to hear public comment relating to the issuance of bonds in an aggregate principal amount not exceeding $32,000,000 (the “Bonds”) to refund the State of Oregon State Board of Higher Education General
Obligation Bonds, 2010 Series A (Tax-Exempt) and the State of Oregon State Board of Higher Education General Obligation Bonds, 2010 Series D (Tax-Exempt) previously issued by the State for
the benefit of Oregon Health and Science University (“OHSU”).

Short Description: Trust Property Transition to the Office of the State Treasurer
Details:
Due to precautions taken related to the pandemic, the hearing will be conducted via Cisco Webex. You may provide written or oral testimony, or both. The State Treasurer will review and consider all testimony and public comments. 

Remote Oral Testimony
You must register by 5:00 PM on May 20, 2021, to testify at the hearing. To register, copy and paste the web link below into your web browser’s address bar. You must provide your name, email address, and the name of the organization or association you represent, if any. Prior to the hearing, you will receive instructions to join as a panelist at the hearing. The hearing will be recorded.
Public Comment Accepted: You may submit public comment by 5:00 PM on May 28, 2021 by emailing OST.Rulemaking@ost.state.or.us

Details: Virtual meeting participation options are provided on the agenda, accessible via the following link.

Short Description: Amends rules for the Oregon Retirement Savings Plan
Details:
Existing law (ORS 178.200 et. seq.) establishes the Oregon Retirement Savings Plan ("Program"). The Program requires
employers that do not provide a Qualified Retirement plan facilitate payroll contributions so that employees may
contribute to a retirement savings plan account in the Program. Employees may opt out of the Program at any time.
Existing law grants the Oregon Retirement Savings Board the authority to adopt rules for the general administration of
the Program, including the authority to collect administrative fees. The proposed rules contained in this notice provide
additional flexibility to the Board in structuring the administrative fees. In addition, the proposed rules extend the time
for the smallest of employers to comply with registration requirements and also clarify employers' responsibilities in the
Program.
Public Comment Accepted: Yes. Deadline is June 22, 2021 at 5 pm

Meeting Title: State of Oregon TEFRA Hearing -- CANCELLED
Short Description: Notice of public hearing regarding Oregon Department of Veterans' Affairs bonds
Details:
A public hearing will be held by the State of Oregon (the “State”), on behalf of the Department of Veterans’ Affairs (the “Department”), at 9:00 a.m. (PT), on Thursday, July 22, 2021 by telephone in accordance with IRS Rev. Proc. 2020-21 (as modified by IRS Rev. Proc. 2020-49), at which time any person may be heard regarding the issuance of one or more series of tax-exempt bonds to be issued pursuant to a plan of finance within the next three years (collectively, the “Bonds”) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $300,000,000.
All proceeds of the Bonds will be used (i) to refund one or more series of bonds previously issued by the State, acting by and through its Office of the State Treasurer and the Department (collectively, the “Issuer”), and/or (ii) to provide funds to finance mortgage loans for housing to be owned and occupied by eligible veterans residing in the State, plus to finance, as needed, certain reserves and issuance costs related to the Bonds. The refunded bonds financed mortgage loans for housing owned and occupied by eligible veterans residing in the State.

Short Description: Oregon Business Development Commission - Beaverton Foods 2022 Bonds
Details:
The Bonds will be issued in an aggregate
principal amount of not more than $8,000,000. The proceeds of the Bonds will be loaned to
Beaverton Foods 7 Acre Property, LLC (the “Company”), which will use the Bond proceeds to
finance a portion of (i) the costs of expanding and equipping a facility used to manufacture
specialty condiments, and other related improvements to the facility (collectively, the “Project”);
and (ii) costs of issuing the Bonds. The Project will be located at 7100 NE Century Blvd.,
Hillsboro, OR, 97124. The Company will be the initial legal owner of the Project.  The Bonds will not be payable from any funds, assets or tax revenues of the State of Oregon or
any agency or instrumentality thereof.
